ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: READ AGENCY is a social service organization rendering valuable services to the children by running two primary schools, hearing impaired school. We are running 10 crÃ¨ches in DINDIGUL district successfully with the valuable supervision of central and state social welfare boards. Short stay home is run by READ from 2002 where women and children are given food, shelter, safety, health care, education and vocational training. SWADHAR home is run by us with the support of Govt. of India from 2004 for 100 women. UJJAWALA home is functioning by us under the financial support of central government for the women in trafficking. Tribal mobile health program is implemented for the remote tribes which helps to promote the health status and reduce IMR(Infant Mortality Rate). Reproductive cum child health care program is implemented for women to prevent anaemia, promotes knowledge to adolescent girls, management of health and hygiene, importance of immunization and institutional delivery. Women empowerment program is implemented for promoting leadership quality economical empowerment, rights, entitlement of women is enhanced, and property rights, marriage rights, allied acts and policies are well known by our series of capacity building activities. Counselling centre is functioning for the promotion of awareness and guidance to the tribes to avoid false hopes and superstitions. We have trained the tribes to utilise medical facilities of government and private hospitals, and to get the financial assistance which is given by state government. READ landed a milestone that we have released 1028 bonded labours from bondage (slavery) from the estate owners of KOKAIKANAL hills, in DINDIGUL district. 1200 self help groups (SHG) were formed and handed over to govt of TAMILNADU. 10 primary schools established in tribal villages of KODAIKANAL hills, and handed over to govt and community. Elders, women children, and differently abled are provided shelter, food, and accommodation. READ has been awarded THE STATE BEST NGO AWARD BY GOVT OF TAMILNADU IN 2008, for its outstanding performance and service rendered to women and children.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our NGO has been working with the tribal in kalrayan hills for past 9 years .we have been in Co-ordination with them through the TNHSP project namely Mobile outreach services for tribal . The project vision is to give treatment to alla tribal mainly those who are unable to move freely to the PHCs especially for AN & PN mothers. we are also having one tribal patient counselling centre in kallakurichi government hostpital. we have also conducted free medical camps and eye camps in villupuram dist .Last year we have treated 16960 persons in kalrayan hills . KGBV residential schools : The government has approved us a scheme called kasthurba gandhi balika vidhyalaya (KGBV) in the year of 2005 through Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan .

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: RURAL RECONSTRUCTION ORGANISATION TIRUNELVELI ANNUAL REPORT 2008-2009 Introduction Rural Reconstruction Organisation (RRO) is a registered voluntary organisation serving the poor and marginalized people of seven blocks in Tirunelveli district in Tamil nadu state in India RRO was established in 1994 with North Ariyanayakipuram as base and took active part in all welfare measures of this area. RRO stands for holistic empowerment of women â€“ who are catalyst for socio economic changes. RRO had under took various development activities such as Sangam formation, basic amenities issues, Old age pension, Bank Credits, Land Patta (title deed) for poor and right based activities for the exploited people. RRO has five member board out of which four are women. RRO has 12 member advisory committee and an auditor and a Development Consultant Activities This year has witnessed many new activities which are far reaching effects on our target people .The following are some of the programmes to mention the depth of our service impact. 1. Group formation activities 2. Federation and Network formation. 3. Training & Development programs. 4. Income generation programs. 5 AIDS prevention activities 5. Free Legal Aid programs 6. Education programs 7. Panchayat Raj Advocacy programs 8. National Environment Awareness Campaign (NAEC ) 9. Free Note books distribution

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Educating rural women become a successful entrepreneur is the aim of this program. Potential women involved in the self-help groups are identified and given training on desired enterprises. The trained women are supported to implement the viable economic development activities. One hundred and ninety women were helped through this project this year. The women become a successful entrepreneur and prosperity rings micro credit organization awarded the successful women entrepreneur.

Scholarship given to students studied in Diploma in Nursing Aid. Fifteen SCC and eleven SC students received scholarship. This scholarship mainly help them for their tuition fees, admission fees, examination fees and hostel fees. The students completed their studies sent for internship and placed them on Job. At present all are employed in a private hospitals and Nursing homes. The scholarship helped them to complete their studies and award certificates. The parents are happy on their success

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Women and Child Development RASTRIYA HAHILA KOSH
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Women Economic Empowerment is a micro credit programme supported by deportment women and child welfare. Three hundred and sixty women beneficiaries received micro credit loan for twelve month tenure. The women borrowers were trained in income generation program and repayment of money for further revolving. Hundred percent repayment ensured by the borrowers to the organisation to women and child development. This program is a viable alternative for rural poor women become economic empowerment.

Twenty seven girl students from scheduled cast community are given educational scholarship. This scholarship given to this students to complete their diploma in Nursing Aid. Tuition fess, exam fess, Hostel fees etc are paid from the scholarship. The students successfully completed and awarded with diploma certificates. Successful students were placed on the job in the private hospitals and nursing homes. This scholarship helped them to reduce the family burden. Twenty seven were benefited.

Educating rural women become a successful entrepreneur is the aim of this program. One hundred and sixth six Potential women involved in the self-help groups are identified and given training on desired enterprises. The trained women are supported to implement the viable economic development activities. One hundred and sixty six women were received financial supported for successful implementation. The successful entrepreneurs are awarded by prosperity rings micro credit organization.

Right to education honored by school and 25 percent of school children were received free education. Education deportment paid the prescribed fees to school for the students. Ten students were benefited out of the program. School fees tuition fee exam fee etc were covered from the fees paid by the education deportment of Tamilnadu.

Diploma in Nursing Aid is a programme conducted by the institution under the approval of TN MGR Medical University. This year we enrolled the required data through online and our Anthoni Ammal Community College was awarded four thousand rupees from AIYUS program under scheme MHRD.

Diploma in Nursing Aid is a programme conducted by the institution under the approval of TN MGR Medical University. This year we enrolled the required data through online and our Anthoni Ammal Community College was awarded three thousand rupees from AIES program under scheme MHRD.

Educating rural women become a successful entrepreneur is the aim of this program. One hundred and sixth Potential women involved in twenty self-help groups are identified and given training on desired enterprises. The District collectors and Govt. high officials have visited our centers. Our staffs are part of Mobile counseling team of police department. Our Sri Ramakrishna Home for the Aged at Gudalur provides shelter, nutritious food, counseling, and a healthy and calm environment for the poor, destitute and abandoned elders. These elders are provided recreational facilities like T.V, newspapers and magazines. Sree Sarada Short Stay Home at Ooty provides counseling, legal aid, shelter, medical care, vocational training, self-confidence to the women and girls who are driven to difficult circumstances due to the tortures of their husbands or mother-in-laws or other family members. Till to day, more than 300 women and girls have been reunited or rehabilitated through our Short Stay Home. The women police extend tremendous support in dealing with the women of complicated problems.We run six crÃ¨ches in around ooty which provide nutritious lunch and tiffin, rudimentary of Education through play way methods. Songs, stories, games, toys etc. are used as tools of education for the children of ailing and working women. A counseling centre for the patients at the Government hospital is run in collaboration with the Health department.

ngoList.ngoName: Saraswathi Foundation for Rural Development and Training
ngoList.address: Saraswathi Foundation for Rural Development and Training, Pulutheri Village, R.T. Malai(PO), Kulithalai(TK), Karur(DT) - 621 313
ngoList.title: Saraswathi Foundation for Rural Development and Training
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Saraswathi Foundation for Rural Development and Training was registered in the year 1995 with the major objectives: â€¢ To provide training for members of the public engaged in agricultural and rural development work in modern methods to enhance crop production. â€¢ To provide professional & Modern Scientific Training for improved working in agricultural, and horticultural and related rural activities like poultry, sericulture and animal husbandry. â€¢ To conduct Youth Programmes and Career Counseling. â€¢ To carry on research and development with regard to rural activities ICAR Krishi Vigyan Kendra was sanctioned by Indian Council of Agricultural Research, New Delhi, during April 2005 for Karur district and the KVK became functional from August 2005. The KVK is fully funded by ICAR and managed by Saraswathi Foundation. Since then KVK has been involved in conducting several On Farm testing of technologies for location specificity, frontline demonstrations and other mandated activities of KVK. The KVK right from the inception has taken up several external projects and has built the capacity of the technical manpower apart from building a knowledge base. The KVK Instructional farm being an Integrated Farming System model also enabled to serve as a knowledge and resource centre for various stakeholders in implementing their programmes. The KVK has provided resource support for different Institutions for capacity building of their group members. In order to have a better reach of farmers of the entre district, the KVK made special efforts to converge with different stakeholders such as Department of Agriculture / Horticulture / Animal Husbandry / Agricultural Engineering / Agricultural Marketing / Cooperatives, District Administration, ATMA, NABARD, Lead bank, IOB RSETI, Pudhu Vaazhvu (World Bank project). The activities under taken in the convergence programmes include implementation of projects, capacity development (training, farm school) and Extension Activities viz., delivery of guest lecture, demonstrations, joint diagnostic visit, field advisory services, study tours, exposure visits, exhibition, mobile advisory services, use of print and mass media, etc. The convergence efforts have reaped the benefits in terms of the following: â€¢ Large scale dissemination of technologies (system of rice intensification, High Density Planting in Banana, mixed fodder cultivation). â€¢ Enhancement of productivity, income and other socio economic benefits. â€¢ Natural resource conservation and rural infrastructure development. â€¢ Mobilizing farmers for group action (farmers club, farmers interest group, farmer â€¢ producer company â€“ Nachalur Farmers Producer Company Ltd.). â€¢ Enabled to serve as a knowledge and resource centre for various stakeholders in implementing their programmes. â€¢ Recognition of KVK Instructional farm as a model farm for school children visit by the District Administration during the year 2015-16. â€¢ Recognition as Producer Organization Promoting Institution of NABARD to promote Farmer Producer Companies. Saraswathi Foundation has also been recognized by National Institute for Agricultural Extension Management (MANAGE), Govt of India as Nodal Training Institute to conduct Agri Clinics and Agri Business Centers Training programme. So far 7 batches of trainings have been conducted.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SASTRA University was established in the year 1984 as Shanmugha College of Engineering and conferred with Deemed University status during 2001 after it was recognised as a PG centre (1997), NBA Accredited (1997), Autonomous (1999), Recommended by AICTE (2000) and UGC (2001). SASTRA University is one among the 31 institutions ranked in the Times Higher Educationâ€“World University Ranking, 2017. Amongst 31 Indian institutions, SASTRA is in the 20th position. In the QSâ€“BRICS 2017 ranking, SASTRA University has been ranked among the top 250 institutions. National Assessment & Accreditation Council with the maximum â€˜Aâ€™ grade and a score of 3.54/4.00 making it the number one of its type in Tamil Nadu and amongst the top 10 in the country. The University offers various UG, PG & Ph.D. programmes in Engineering, Science, Management, Law and Arts. Recognised as a Scientific & Industrial Research Organisation by the Government of India and with the support of funding agencies like DST, DBT, DRDO, ISRO, AYUSH, etc. and other private organisations, the research output of SASTRA has been progressively significant. Since its inception in 1984, SASTRA has established various milestones â€“ AICTE approval (1993), PG Centre (1998), TIFAC-CORE Centre (1999), Autonomous status (2000), Deemed University (2001), various centres for teaching & research like Srinivasa Ramanujan Centre, Centre for Nanotechnology, Centre for Indian System of Medicine, National Facility in Robotics, Recognition as Scientific & Industrial Research Organisation, Teacher Education, Distance Education, Legal Education, Department of Sanskrit, Astrology, etc. (2001-2015) and each one of them accomplished after following the due process laid down by the respective statutory authorities. SASTRA has established the Srinivasa Ramaujan Centre at Kumbakonam in 1999 and is recognised by MHRD as an off-campus centre. This centre has purchased the house of Mathematical genius Srinivasa Ramanujan and maintaining it as a monument and also has a museum on Ramanujan. The admission system of SASTRA is transparent and based on merit and not a single rupee is collected as capitation fees or donation. A strong collaborative relationship with top US universities like Harvard-MIT, Georgia Tech, etc., & many European and Asia-Pacific universities and with industry partners like TCS, IBM, Microsoft, TVS, etc. in the area of Research, Specialised Training and other development activities. Interface with society is truly national, regional and local. Personal visits to Uttarakhand, Kashmir and other places during the times of natural disasters for relief distribution, Free formal & skill education and providing educational resources for socio-economically challenged, research to provide low cost solutions like healthcare diagnostics, water body cleaning agent, artificial skin are some socially relevant initiatives besides the various activities under the SCORE programme. Efforts in propagating Indian Culture & Ethics have been significant. With courses on Indian Womanhood, Life & Message of Swami Vivekananda, Vedic Mathematics, Gandhian Studies, Rediscovery of India, Bhagavad Gita, Vedanta, etc., Degree programmes in Astrology, Sanskrit, and Research initiatives in Legal Anthropology, Integrated Humanism, Vedanta, etc., SASTRAs efforts through its Department of Oriental Studies have shaped the minds and careers of its students and created positive impact amongst various concerned stakeholders. SASTRA marches into its fourth decade with a committed management, qualified & dedicated faculty, youthful & bright students looking forward to a supporting ecosystem. The efforts of SASTRA in being a composite university offering high quality teaching, research, consultancy & training - the ingredients of a truly integrated university will continue to remain undiluted.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: My School Satya Surabhi was founded in 1999 with 20 children in a small shed in our compound. My School Satya Surabhi managed by Satya Surabhi Trust provides free quality value based education. We are recognized by the deportment of Elementary Education Government of Tamil Nadu and also accreited to the National Institute of Open Schooling.In addition to the Academics My School Satya Surabhi also belives in the Empowerment of Women to realise this goal . We (a) run literecy classes for rural woman. (b) teach them models of Economic self sufficiency food. (c) teach their Health care practices because we believe that teaching a women all of the above in infect teaching the entire family. CHILDREN OF RAG PICKERS: We run classes in education at the primary level for Rag Pickers children togive them selfesteem and literecy. We also give them basic health care. Environtment - The fragile eco- system of the Palani Hills is a matter of concern to us. We teach our students to prodect / nuture the environment.
